data.title: Subject knowledge, subject matter, and subject
data.meta_description:
What are the differences between subject, subject matter, subject knowledge?

I think the first means the subject itself like math and history, but the...
data.text:
1-The teacher's professional competence entails a complete understanding of the subject matter he teaches to deliver the lesson appropriately.

In one, subject matter refers to the subject he or she teaches.

2. Too meet the standardized teaching criteria, one should have a full scale of the subject knowledge in the field he teaches in.

2- in two, subject knowledge pertains the experiences and skills the person has in particular field.

In one, subject matter refers to the subject he or she teaches.

Here simply 'subject' would be correct.

' . . . a complete understanding of the subject matter he or she teaches . . . '

2- in two, subject knowledge pertains the experiences and skills the person has in particular field.

This sentence has several errors, and 'subject knowledge' is one of them. It doesn't make any sense. Have you seen it somewhere?

'Knowledge of the subject' might work, but the sentence needs to be significantly rewritten.

May I ask why subject matter is incorrect?

'Subject matter' is the theme or topic or substance of, say, a conversation, or letter, or document. It's not a 'subject', like history, geography, Latin or physics, that a teacher might teach.

subject matter - WordReference.com Dictionary of English

I can't remember the context of "subject knowledge". I hope my understanding of subject knowledge is correct.

I can't imagine any sentence or context that might include "subject knowledge". I recommend forgetting it.

Could please specify what mistakes I made in explaining what subject knowledge is?

Subject knowledge is used in pedagogical context.

There are many examples:

1-Strong subject knowledge is the most important component of being a good teacher, a major education conference has heard.

Subject knowledge is prime factor in good teaching, experts say - Madrassah

2-Tom points out that subject knowledge adds texture to a lesson â€“ it gives the details. It varies hugely by subject, but Geography is a discipline made of connections. You never quite know what knowledge might be relevant to a lesson until something comes up.

Developing subject knowledge

Now another question arises , what is the difference between subject knowledge and specialized knowledge?

1-Strong subject knowledge is the most important component of being a good teacher,

subject knowledge adds texture to a lesson

These are both fine. You could exchange subject knowledge for specialized knowledge if you wanted, but since we talk about subjects when discussing teaching, it doesn't improve the sentence to change the wording. It makes sense here to use subject knowledge.
